intro: Verticordia chrysostachys var. chrysostachys, commonly known as the golden club, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its striking yellow inflorescences that resemble a cluster of small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. It is a member of the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees.
